TCP_Campaign__c.Online solution: Digital-first approach - online setup and self-service features
TCP_Campaign__c.Engage Digital: Omnichannel engagement - digital-first customer experience tools
TCP_Campaign__c.Connected Retail Experience: Retail - enhancing customer touchpoints across channels
TCP_Campaign__c.Optimizing the Workforce: Productivity-focused - better internal communication and coordination
TCP_Campaign__c.Connecting the Higher Ed Campus: Colleges and universities - scalable platform for faculty and students
TCP_Campaign__c.Connected Banking Experience: Financial institutions - secure, modern customer communications
TCP_Campaign__c.UC+CC: Unified UCaaS and CCaaS - full-stack communications for contact and collaboration

TCP_Program__c.Greenfield: Ongoing evergreen campaign - continous lead flow
TCP_Program__c.Integrated Campaigns + ABM: Account-based marketing - targeted approach for specific high-value accounts

TCP_Theme__c.RingCX Acquisition: New contact center buyer - replacing or implementing first CC solution
TCP_Theme__c.On-Prem To Cloud: Migrating from on-premise PBX - cost savings and modernization focus
TCP_Theme__c.Brand Acquisition: General brand awareness campaign - top of funnel
TCP_Theme__c.RingCX Expansion: Existing customer adding contact center - upsell opportunity
TCP_Theme__c.Top Target Expansion: Strategic upsell within key existing accounts
TCP_Theme__c.RingSense Expansion: Driving adoption of RingSense among exisitng customers
TCP_Theme__c.Compete: Focused on competitive takeaways - campaigns that position RingCentral vs rivals
TCP_Theme__c.RingEX SMB Expansion: Upselling RingEX to existing small business customers
TCP_Theme__c.RingEX: New Target Verticals: Targeting new industries/ verticals with RingEX
TCP_Theme__c.Vertical: Finserv: Financial services focused - compliance and security are key concerns
TCP_Theme__c.AIR Acquisition: Driving awarness for AIR product among new leads
TCP_Theme__c.Microsoft Teams: Co-positioned campaigns that integrate with Teams - common for IT/tech-led buyers
TCP_Theme__c.Vertical: Public Sector: Government/public sector campaigns - often long sales cycles, RFP-based
TCP_Theme__c.RingEX Upmarket Expansion: Upsell within Majors/ Enterprise customer base
TCP_Theme__c.RingEX SMB Acquisition: Targeting small business (1-499 employees) - faster sales cycle, price sensitive
TCP_Theme__c.RingEX Upmarket Acquisition: Targeting Majors (500-4999) and Enterprise (5000+) for UCaaS - complex buying process
TCP_Theme__c.AIR Expansion: Upselling AIR product to current customers

Type.Partners: Partner-generated lead - comes with partner context
Type.Speaking Session: Engagement from a speaker-led session, typically at events or webinars
Type.Partner: Partner-generated lead - comes with partner context
Type.CPL Shared: Shared cost per lead program - leads generated via shared content syndication agreements
Type.CPL_Shared: Shared cost per lead program - leads generated via shared content syndication agreements
Type.Seminar / Conference: In-person or virtual multi-speaker events - longer format, high context exposure
Type.CPL_Shared_UK: Shared cost per lead program - leads generated via shared content syndication agreements
Type.Email Only: Generic email campaign engagment - intent and quality depend on content
Type.Banner Ads: Display ad lead - often low-intent, top-of-funnel traffic
Type.Partner Campaign: Joint campaign with partner - co-marketing effort
Type.Purchased List: Lead came from a third-party list purchase - intent is uncertain, low trust factor
Type.Email_Nurture: Nurture email engagement - existing lead re-engaged
Type.CPL_Content: Cost-per-lead content campaign - downloaded gated content
Type.Referral Program: Lead came via a referral incentive - often from existing customers
Type.eSeminars: Educational webinar, often with product or thought leadership
Type.Advertisement: Ad campaign response - varying intent based on ad type
Type.Events: Event-based engagement - webinar, conference, or meeting attendance
Type.Sales Generated: Lead created by sales team efforts, such as referrals or AE outreach
Type.PreShow: General event-driven engagement, such as conferences or summits
Type.eSeminar: Educational webinar, often with product or thought leadership
Type.Booth Scan/Event Attendees: Physical event interaction - lead scanned at a booth or attended an in-person event
Type.Dinner/Lunch: High-touch, relationship-focused engagements - small format, often invite-only
Type.Telemarketing: Phone-baesd outbound lead generation - typically cold or warm calling
Type.Event: General event-driven engagement, such as conferences or summits
Type.CPL_Content_UK: Cost per lead content download - gated assets like whitepapers or reports
Type.CPL_Content_100+: Cost per lead content download - gated assets like whitepapers or reports
Type.Government: Likely internal campaign types specific to industry segments
Type.Professional Services: Likely internal campaign types specific to industry segments
Type.Direct Mail: Offline direct outreach, usually physical mailers to high-value targets
Type.Webinar: Targeted online session - intent can range from low (awareness) to high (solution-eval)
Type.Email_Prospecting: Outbound email prospecting - cold to warm outreach
Type.Meetings: Direct meeting campaign - focused on booking qualified conversations
Type.Email: Generic email campaign engagment - intent and quality depend on content
Type.Public Relations: Engagment generated from a PR activity, like a press release or media mention

Vendor__c.TechTarget: IT decision maker research site - technical buyer
Vendor__c.ZoomInfo: B2B contact database - sales prospecting tool
Vendor__c.Clearbit: Data enrichment provider - company/ contact data
Vendor__c.Lusha: B2B contact finder - direct dials and emails

Vertical__c.Real Estate: Real estate sector - mobile workforce, high call volume, lead management needs
Vertical__c.High Tech: Tech industry - rapid growth, scalability needs, early adopters of new platforms
Vertical__c.Non-Profit: Non-profit sector - budget conscious, mission-driven, donor and volunteer communication needs
Vertical__c.Professional Services: Consulting/ accounting/ agency - client facing, high call volume, service quality emphasis
Vertical__c.Education: Education sector - budget constraints, E-rate eligible
Vertical__c.Construction: Construction industry - mobile teams, job site coordination, subcontractor communication
Vertical__c.Transportation: Transportation/ logistics - real-time coordination, driver communication, route updates
Vertical__c.Manufacturing: Manufacturing - internal coordination across departments, supply chain communications
Vertical__c.Telecommunications: Telecom - competitive space, looking for service differentiation, uptime is critical
Vertical__c.Recruiting: Staffing/ recruiting firms - frequent outreach, high call/ email volume, CRM integration needs
Vertical__c.Entertainment and Media: Media companies - dynamic teams, live event coordination, high-quality AV communication needs
Vertical__c.Financial Services: Financial industry - security and compilance focus
Vertical__c.Other: Miscellaneous - industry not specified; assess based on size, region, and campaign context
Vertical__c.Hospitality: Hospitality - guest services coordination, front desk call handling, seasonal hiring patterns
Vertical__c.Public Sector: Broader public sector - includes education, local/ state/ federal agenices, often security and budget-driven
Vertical__c.Government: Government sector - procurement process, security requirements

Marketing_Message__c.Easily set up and grow my business: SMB messaging - simplicity and growth focus

Company_Size_Context.SOHO: 1-19 employees - price sensitive, needs simple solution
Company_Size_Context.Enterprise: 5000+ employees - strategic sale, long cycle, compliance critical
